name: Ying Wen 0001
content: Ying Wen Search Ying Wen Associate Professor School of Artificial Intelligence John Hopcroft Center for Computer Science Shanghai Jiao Tong University Biography Ying Wen is now a tenure-track associate professor in School of Artificial Intelligence and John Hopcroft Center, Shanghai Jiao Tong University. His research interests include deep reinforcement learning, multi-agent systems, game theory and machine learning systems. He received his PhD in the Department of Computer Science, University College London in 2020. Before that, Ying earned his MRes(Master of Research) with Distinction Honor from University College London in 2016 and B.Eng. with First Class Honor from Queen Mary, University of London and Beijing University of Posts and Tel. in 2015. He was an intern at Huawei, MediaGamma, Amazon and Baidu. Recent News Selected preprints. Language Games as the Pathway to Artificial Superhuman Intelligence. Rema: Learning to meta-think for llms with multi-agent reinforcement learning. Natural language reinforcement learning. Openr: An open source framework for advanced reasoning with large language models. A survey of ai agent protocols. AT-Drone: Benchmarking Adaptive Teaming in Multi-Drone Pursuit. [05/25] Two papers get accepted in ACL 2025. Leveraging dual process theory in language agent framework for real-time simultaneous human-AI collaboration. Retrieval-Augmented Process Reward Model for Generalizable Mathematical Reasoning.
